else if(itemUsed == 113 && useWith == 24) {
					if(playerLevel[25] >= 0) {
						deleteItem(24, getItemSlot(24), 1);
						deleteItem(113, getItemSlot(113), 1);
						addItem(1917, 1);
						addSkillXP(100, 25);
					} else {
						sendMessage("You need 0 drink mixing to make this drink.");
					}
				}
				else if(itemUsed == 24 && useWith == 113) {
					if(playerLevel[25] >= 0) {
						deleteItem(24, getItemSlot(24), 1);
						deleteItem(113, getItemSlot(113), 1);
						addItem(1917, 1);
						addSkillXP(100, 25);

item.title: Public Void ParseIncomingPackets() {
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

lol…parseincomingpackets reads lines in code, whatever you were just adding, or editing, put the entire thing in a void, and then put the void in place of it. parseincomingpackets has too many lines to read, but if you void it, example: put it in

public void voidName() {
shitHere();
}

then you put the stuff you were adding inplace of shitHere();
then where the code was, youd put

voidName();

this makes parseincomingpackets only have to read one line (voidName() instead of all the code that was there before, parseincomingpackets isnt too large, theres too many lines for it to read. i had this error and thats how I fixed it.

Read full topic
